**Highest Daoist Scripture of Wenchang, Lord of Fortune, Purple Yang Treasure Scrolls**
*(Title: Highest Daoist Scripture of Wenchang, Lord of Fortune, Purple Yang Treasure Scrolls)*

**Author Unknown**, approximately from the Ming Dynasty.
Falsely attributed to Wenchang Di Jun (Celestial Lord of Literature and Fortune) descending to bestow talismans, diagrams, and divine spells.
Three volumes.
Source text: *Zhengtong Daozang* (Orthodox Daoist Canon), First Section.

---

**Volume One of the Highest Daoist Scripture of Wenchang, Lord of Fortune, Purple Yang Treasure Scrolls**

A certain devout Daoist practitioner residing in [location], humbly states:
*"By fate, I was born on the [year], [month], [day], and [hour] of the [stellar time], under the governance of the [specific star] of the Northern Dipper. On that very day, with utmost reverence, I knelt before the Master of the Dao, the Celestial True Person of the Heavenly Teacher, and received the *Highest Daoist Scripture of Wenchang, Lord of Fortune, Purple Yang Treasure Scrolls*. I now wear it with devotion, swearing to uphold the orthodox teachings, discipline myself, enhance my talents, sharpen my wisdom, sever demonic obstacles, banish malevolent spirits, achieve scholarly distinction, and ascend to positions of fortune.*

*After receiving this sacred text, I dare not reveal its mysteries lightly, lest I incur the wrath of the Daoist Master and betray my solemn vow. I shall strictly adhere to the laws and decrees of the Wenchang Upper Palace."*

---

**The Nine-Heavens Enlightenment Chapter of Wenchang**

At that time, the Sovereign of Nine-Heavens Enlightenment, the Radiant True Observer, the Precious Light Celestial Venerable (*Chéngzhēn Zhèngguān Bǎoguāng Tiānzūn*), in the year of *Chóngguāng Chìfèn Ruò* (a cyclical year name), when the sun was in the *Chuntuǐ* (a lunar mansion), and the moon was at the *Dōngbì* (East Wall) hour, descended into the *Bǎopíng Shān* (Treasure Screen Mountain) in the Shu capital, at the *Héshèng Yīngzhī Lóu* (Harmonious Sincerity Responding Hall) and the *Xuànhuì Yùxū Tán* (Mysterious Gathering Jade Emptiness Altar). He announced to the *Luánfǔ Shìxiān Zhēnrén* (Luanfu Attendant Immortal Sī Liú Ānshèng*), saying:

*"In past ages, I received the jade edict of the Most High Emperor, entrusted with overseeing the *Guìjí* (the celestial register of worthy scholars), promoting literary scholars to noble ranks, and advancing virtuous officials to aid the enlightened age. Thus, I was appointed to govern the Celestial Chancellery, specializing in bestowing fortune, recording the Underworld, determining noble ranks, measuring the Watery Realm, and selecting the worthy. I oversee the tripartite examinations of the Three Offices (Heaven, Earth, and Water).*

*In the years of selection, I, together with the Three Elements and Three Officials, the Five Directions and Five Emperors, the Three Celestial Stems and Five Stars of the Dipper, and the myriad luminaries, coordinate with the Three Mysteries, examine the *qi* and fate, and decree the Celestial Chancellery’s Bureau of Fixed Destiny and Noble Rank, the Earthly Bureau of Tai Mountain, the Watery Bureau of the Northern Netherworld, and the Imperial Lord of Fúsāng. We convene the Nine-Heavens Enlightenment Wenchang Grand Marshal’s Office to assess the nine regions and their constellations, determining the ranks of the three fortunes, three noble ranks, and three virtues—high or low—and further investigate the ancestral, parental, and familial lineages across lifetimes, whether they possess hidden virtues and filial piety or accumulated grudges, debts, lawsuits, curses, karmic roots, and demonic foundations, as well as their Five Phases and fateful allotments, calculating their directional numbers and recording them all.*

*If a lineage possesses hidden virtues and profound filial piety, with a sturdy foundation of virtue, even if their fate is declining, their merits will overcome it, and they shall be granted added fortune and longevity, ascending to noble selection and entering the register of fortune.*

*If their virtues are great and their foundation strong, yet their grudges, debts, and calamities persist, they shall first be enrolled in the register of the worthy, their names recorded in the noble ranks, awaiting the exhaustion of their misfortune and the extinction of their guilt before receiving their fortune.*

*If their fate aligns with noble rank and fortune, yet they lack hidden virtues, great deeds, or a hundred acts of loyalty and filial piety, their fortune shall be withdrawn, their noble rank stripped, their name erased from the register, and they shall await the establishment of virtue, the accumulation of goodness, and the gathering of blessings before being re-entered into the noble ranks and granted fortune and renown.*

*Should literary scholars and worthy men, knowing their fate, repent their errors, cultivate virtue, and refine their studies—though their fate is noble and their hidden merits slight, their karmic bonds heavy with grudges and debts, and demonic spirits obstructing their advancement and clouding their divine insight—I shall bestow upon them the *Great Daoist Treasure Scrolls of Wenchang’s Upper Palace*, dispelling all demonic obstacles and awakening their innate wisdom.*

*This text was formerly concealed within the jade palace of the Supreme Origin, the Holy Pure Realm, the Vast Effulgence Heavenly Palace, the Golden Gate Jade Chamber, and the cloud-silk pouch. It was transmitted to the Jade Sovereign Great Daoist Lord (*Yùchén Dà Dàojūn*), then passed from the Most High Laozi to the Purple Micro Emperor and the Supreme One Lord. It was further transmitted to the Holy Ancestor, the Yellow Emperor, then to Emperor Yao, Emperor Shun, and the Divine Yu.*

*Yu transmitted it to Liu Yue, Yue to Wang Jing, Jing to Peng Taiji, Taiji to Deng Yuan, Yuan to Liu Yi, Yi to Liu Dongzhen, Dongzhen to Wang Yuan, Yuan to Peng Xiao, Xiao to Liu Xiyue, Xiyue to Lan Gongqiào, and Gongqiào to Peng Dezhi.*

*Thus, ten thousand saints and true ones all received the transmission.*

*Those with accumulated blessings and predestined fortune who seek a master to receive this transmission must sincerely present offerings, follow the ritual protocols, and pledge with gold and silk to uphold the covenant. The transmitting master must be one who has received the Three Daoist Canons, the Four Auxiliaries, and the Nine-Heavens Golden Scrolls, only then may they follow the protocols to initiate the transmission. If their virtue and rank are still modest and their merits unproven, they must not presumptuously claim the title of master or recklessly divulge the sacred texts.*

*To hold and practice this scroll in accordance with its teachings can dissolve ancestral grudges, cease lawsuits and calamities, sever evil karmic roots, subdue demonic foundations, and dispel suffering. It can rob spirits of their divine insight, cause malevolent ghosts to flee, annihilate demons that disrupt nature, and crush evil that obstructs nobility. If one’s fate is grim and their destiny low, yet they revere this secret text without negligence, diligently tend to incense and offerings, and meditate upon the scriptures and incantations, they shall avert celestial calamities, repel earthly disasters, extend their fortune, sever demonic influences, clarify their divine nature, and flourish in literary brilliance.*

*If one’s fate is not yet noble and their literary endeavors stifled, yet they faithfully adhere to this treasure scroll and practice accordingly, they must solely dedicate themselves to benefiting others—severing poison, healing the sick, and saving at least three hundred and sixty people. Accumulating such great merit, they shall ascend to high fortune and noble rank, be recorded in the worthy registers, and aid the enlightened age as the most noble of officials. Their fortune shall extend to their descendants, bringing glory to their lineage."*

「If one can practice the wondrous *miao* methods (*妙行*) of the scriptures and treasure scrolls (*经箓*), maintaining purity of body and mind, clarity of *shen* and *qi*, and even in advanced years (*年齿既高*), they shall attain the *Taiyin* Refinement of Form (*太阴炼形*), achieving the *Shixie* Dao (*尸解之道*)—transcending the cycle of rebirth (*轮转*), ascending to the Daoist Celestial Capital (*仙都*), and becoming a True Person (*真人*).

All faithful and sincere practitioners (*清信之士*) who receive my treasure scrolls (*吾箓*) shall be petitioned by me before the Jade Emperor (*玉帝*) at the Golden Gate (*金阙*), recorded in the registers of the Three Elements (*三元*)—the Celestial Bureau of Fate (*天曹*), Earthly Bureau of Fate (*地府*), and Watery Bureau of Fate (*水府*)—for noble rank (*禄贵贤籍*), ensuring their body and mind remain ever enlightened (*究竟不昧*), and their entry into the ranks of the worthy (*贵籍*), aiding the enlightened age (*明时*).

The following are the Nine Heavenly Rankings (*九天较定*) for the Three Elements’ registers of noble rank (*天曹地府水府三禄三贵三贤科品*), now proclaimed:

**First Bureau of the Heavenly Register (*上元天曹*) at Yuefu (*岳府*), overseeing celestial fortune (*司禄*), with three divisions (*三科三品*):**
1. **First Division** – *Celestial Fortune Science (*天禄科*)*
   Upper Rank: *Purple Micro Celestial Official (*紫微天官*)*
   Middle Rank: *Grand Micro Celestial Official (*太微斗官*)*
   Lower Rank: *Lesser Micro Celestial Official (*少微星官*)*

2. **Second Division** – *Human Fortune Science (*人禄科*)*
   Upper Rank: *Kings, Dukes, Marquesses, and Earls (*王公卿侯爵*)*
   Middle Rank: *Regional Governors and Inspectors (*方伯监牧爵*)*
   Lower Rank: *All other officials and scattered ranks (*百官散秩爵*)*

3. **Third Division** – *Subterranean Fortune Science (*幽禄科*)*
   Upper Rank: *Officials of Yuefu (*岳府官僚*)*
   Middle Rank: *Officials of Dengdu (*邓都官僚*)*
   Lower Rank: *Officials of Fusan (*扶桑官僚*)*

**Second Bureau of the Earthly Register (*中元地府*) at Dengdu (*邓都*), determining noble rank (*定贵*), with three divisions (*三科三品*):**
1. **First Division** – *Upper Noble Science (*上贵科*)*
   Upper Rank: *Filial Piety (*孝行*)*
   Middle Rank: *Chastity and Devotion (*守节*)*
   Lower Rank: *Yin Virtue (*阴德*)*

2. **Second Division** – *Middle Noble Science (*中贵科*)*
   Upper Rank: *Kindness and Mercy (*仁慈*)*
   Middle Rank: *Righteousness and Benevolence (*康义*)*
   Lower Rank: *Moral Conduct (*德行*)*

3. **Third Division** – *Lower Noble Science (*下贵科*)*
   Upper Rank: *Worthy and Virtuous (*贤达*)*
   Middle Rank: *Ancestral Virtue (*祖德*)*
   Lower Rank: *Literary Merit (*文学*)*

**Third Bureau of the Watery Register (*下元水府*) at Fusan (*扶桑*), advancing the worthy (*进贤*), with three divisions (*三科三品*):**
1. **First Division** – *Upper Worthy Science (*上贤科*)*
   Upper Rank: *Supreme Filial Piety (*至孝*)*
   Middle Rank: *Great Loyalty (*大忠*)*
   Lower Rank: *Kindness and Mercy (*慈仁*)*

2. **Second Division** – *Middle Worthy Science (*中贤科*)*
   Upper Rank: *Worthy through Righteousness and Benevolence (*康义之贤*)*
   Middle Rank: *Worthy through Ritual and Law (*礼法之贤*)*
   Lower Rank: *Worthy through Wisdom and Guidance (*智度之贤*)*

3. **Third Division** – *Lower Worthy Science (*下贤科*)*
   Upper Rank: *Worthy through Sincere Conduct (*笃行之贤*)*
   Middle Rank: *Worthy through Talent and Learning (*才学之贤*)*
   Lower Rank: *Worthy through Allotted Destiny (*分定之贤*)*

All the above divisions and ranks shall be used to evaluate the world’s people (*较录世人*). Those who enter these divisions and ranks shall be granted celestial fortune (*注禄*), noble rank (*定贵*), and advancement in the worthy registers (*进在贤籍*).

I shall dispatch the *Yanpu* Daoist Officials (*演谱仙官*), who shall assist and extol virtuous deeds (*翊赞善功*), illuminate divine insight (*开明神鉴*), and send the *Chuzuo* Divine Assistants (*储佐列神*) to sever demonic obstacles (*断除魔障*), bestowing upon them the Heavenly Edicts and Jade Scriptures (*天章玉文*), safeguarding their vital fields (*镇护身田*). Auspicious signs shall manifest (*兆祥应寝*), and the True *Qi* of the Central Emperor (*中皇真炁*) shall nourish their body and mind (*启沃身心*). By imperial decree (*敕*), the gods of tranquil will and enlightened wisdom (*安志益慧之神*) shall be invoked to settle the hundred critical junctures (*定百关*), sharpen their acuity, and guide them to clarity (*开聪导明*), advancing their talents (*进其才华*) and refining their spiritual insight (*通其灵鉴*), just as decreed in the *Wenchang* Science and Legal Edicts (*文昌科法律令*).

This Sovereign (*帝君*) bears the surname Zhang (*张姓*), with the given name Ya (*讳亚*), corresponding to the constellations Zhang and Yi (*上应张翼二宿*), born in the Zhou Dynasty’s early era (*周初*) at the Radiant Gathering place (*昊会之地*), on the third day of the second month (*二月三日*) as his sacred birthday (*圣诞*).

**Highest Daoist Scripture of Wenchang, Lord of Fortune, Purple Yang Treasure Scrolls**
*(Title: Highest Daoist Scripture of Wenchang, Lord of Fortune, Purple Yang Treasure Scrolls)*

**Author Unknown**, approximately from the Ming Dynasty.
Falsely attributed to Wenchang Di Jun (Celestial Lord of Literature and Fortune) descending to bestow talismans, diagrams, and divine spells.
Three volumes.
Source text: *Zhengtong Daozang* (Orthodox Daoist Canon), First Section.

---

**Volume One of the Highest Daoist Scripture of Wenchang, Lord of Fortune, Purple Yang Treasure Scrolls**

A certain devout Daoist practitioner residing in [location], humbly states:
*"By fate, I was born on the [year], [month], [day], and [hour] of the [stellar time], under the governance of the [specific star] of the Northern Dipper. On that very day, with utmost reverence, I knelt before the Master of the Dao, the Celestial True Person of the Heavenly Teacher, and received the *Highest Daoist Scripture of Wenchang, Lord of Fortune, Purple Yang Treasure Scrolls*. I now wear it with devotion, swearing to uphold the orthodox teachings, discipline myself, enhance my talents, sharpen my wisdom, sever demonic obstacles, banish malevolent spirits, achieve scholarly distinction, and ascend to positions of fortune.*

*After receiving this sacred text, I dare not reveal its mysteries lightly, lest I incur the wrath of the Daoist Master and betray my solemn vow. I shall strictly adhere to the laws and decrees of the Wenchang Upper Palace."*

---

**The Nine-Heavens Enlightenment Chapter of Wenchang**

At that time, the Sovereign of Nine-Heavens Enlightenment, the Radiant True Observer, the Precious Light Celestial Venerable (*Chéngzhēn Zhèngguān Bǎoguāng Tiānzūn*), in the year of *Chóngguāng Chìfèn Ruò* (a cyclical year name), when the sun was in the *Chuntuǐ* (a lunar mansion), and the moon was at the *Dōngbì* (East Wall) hour, descended into the *Bǎopíng Shān* (Treasure Screen Mountain) in the Shu capital, at the *Héshèng Yīngzhī Lóu* (Harmonious Sincerity Responding Hall) and the *Xuànhuì Yùxū Tán* (Mysterious Gathering Jade Emptiness Altar). He announced to the *Luánfǔ Shìxiān Zhēnrén* (Luanfu Attendant Immortal Sī Liú Ānshèng*), saying:

*"In past ages, I received the jade edict of the Most High Emperor, entrusted with overseeing the *Guìjí* (the celestial register of worthy scholars), promoting literary scholars to noble ranks, and advancing virtuous officials to aid the enlightened age. Thus, I was appointed to govern the Celestial Chancellery, specializing in bestowing fortune, recording the Underworld, determining noble ranks, measuring the Watery Realm, and selecting the worthy. I oversee the tripartite examinations of the Three Offices (Heaven, Earth, and Water).*

*In the years of selection, I, together with the Three Elements and Three Officials, the Five Directions and Five Emperors, the Three Celestial Stems and Five Stars of the Dipper, and the myriad luminaries, coordinate with the Three Mysteries, examine the *qi* and fate, and decree the Celestial Chancellery’s Bureau of Fixed Destiny and Noble Rank, the Earthly Bureau of Tai Mountain, the Watery Bureau of the Northern Netherworld, and the Imperial Lord of Fúsāng. We convene the Nine-Heavens Enlightenment Wenchang Grand Marshal’s Office to assess the nine regions and their constellations, determining the ranks of the three fortunes, three noble ranks, and three virtues—high or low—and further investigate the ancestral, parental, and familial lineages across lifetimes, whether they possess hidden virtues and filial piety or accumulated grudges, debts, lawsuits, curses, karmic roots, and demonic foundations, as well as their Five Phases and fateful allotments, calculating their directional numbers and recording them all.*

*If a lineage possesses hidden virtues and profound filial piety, with a sturdy foundation of virtue, even if their fate is declining, their merits will overcome it, and they shall be granted added fortune and longevity, ascending to noble selection and entering the register of fortune.*

*If their virtues are great and their foundation strong, yet their grudges, debts, and calamities persist, they shall first be enrolled in the register of the worthy, their names recorded in the noble ranks, awaiting the exhaustion of their misfortune and the extinction of their guilt before receiving their fortune.*

*If their fate aligns with noble rank and fortune, yet they lack hidden virtues, great deeds, or a hundred acts of loyalty and filial piety, their fortune shall be withdrawn, their noble rank stripped, their name erased from the register, and they shall await the establishment of virtue, the accumulation of goodness, and the gathering of blessings before being re-entered into the noble ranks and granted fortune and renown.*

*Should literary scholars and worthy men, knowing their fate, repent their errors, cultivate virtue, and refine their studies—though their fate is noble and their hidden merits slight, their karmic bonds heavy with grudges and debts, and demonic spirits obstructing their advancement and clouding their divine insight—I shall bestow upon them the *Great Daoist Treasure Scrolls of Wenchang’s Upper Palace*, dispelling all demonic obstacles and awakening their innate wisdom.*

*This text was formerly concealed within the jade palace of the Supreme Origin, the Holy Pure Realm, the Vast Effulgence Heavenly Palace, the Golden Gate Jade Chamber, and the cloud-silk pouch. It was transmitted to the Jade Sovereign Great Daoist Lord (*Yùchén Dà Dàojūn*), then passed from the Most High Laozi to the Purple Micro Emperor and the Supreme One Lord. It was further transmitted to the Holy Ancestor, the Yellow Emperor, then to Emperor Yao, Emperor Shun, and the Divine Yu.*

*Yu transmitted it to Liu Yue, Yue to Wang Jing, Jing to Peng Taiji, Taiji to Deng Yuan, Yuan to Liu Yi, Yi to Liu Dongzhen, Dongzhen to Wang Yuan, Yuan to Peng Xiao, Xiao to Liu Xiyue, Xiyue to Lan Gongqiào, and Gongqiào to Peng Dezhi.*

*Thus, ten thousand saints and true ones all received the transmission.*

*Those with accumulated blessings and predestined fortune who seek a master to receive this transmission must sincerely present offerings, follow the ritual protocols, and pledge with gold and silk to uphold the covenant. The transmitting master must be one who has received the Three Daoist Canons, the Four Auxiliaries, and the Nine-Heavens Golden Scrolls, only then may they follow the protocols to initiate the transmission. If their virtue and rank are still modest and their merits unproven, they must not presumptuously claim the title of master or recklessly divulge the sacred texts.*

*To hold and practice this scroll in accordance with its teachings can dissolve ancestral grudges, cease lawsuits and calamities, sever evil karmic roots, subdue demonic foundations, and dispel suffering. It can rob spirits of their divine insight, cause malevolent ghosts to flee, annihilate demons that disrupt nature, and crush evil that obstructs nobility. If one’s fate is grim and their destiny low, yet they revere this secret text without negligence, diligently tend to incense and offerings, and meditate upon the scriptures and incantations, they shall avert celestial calamities, repel earthly disasters, extend their fortune, sever demonic influences, clarify their divine nature, and flourish in literary brilliance.*

*If one’s fate is not yet noble and their literary endeavors stifled, yet they faithfully adhere to this treasure scroll and practice accordingly, they must solely dedicate themselves to benefiting others—severing poison, healing the sick, and saving at least three hundred and sixty people. Accumulating such great merit, they shall ascend to high fortune and noble rank, be recorded in the worthy registers, and aid the enlightened age as the most noble of officials. Their fortune shall extend to their descendants, bringing glory to their lineage."*

「If one can practice the wondrous *miao* methods (*妙行*) of the scriptures and treasure scrolls (*经箓*), maintaining purity of body and mind, clarity of *shen* and *qi*, and even in advanced years (*年齿既高*), they shall attain the *Taiyin* Refinement of Form (*太阴炼形*), achieving the *Shixie* Dao (*尸解之道*)—transcending the cycle of rebirth (*轮转*), ascending to the Daoist Celestial Capital (*仙都*), and becoming a True Person (*真人*).

All faithful and sincere practitioners (*清信之士*) who receive my treasure scrolls (*吾箓*) shall be petitioned by me before the Jade Emperor (*玉帝*) at the Golden Gate (*金阙*), recorded in the registers of the Three Elements (*三元*)—the Celestial Bureau of Fate (*天曹*), Earthly Bureau of Fate (*地府*), and Watery Bureau of Fate (*水府*)—for noble rank (*禄贵贤籍*), ensuring their body and mind remain ever enlightened (*究竟不昧*), and their entry into the ranks of the worthy (*贵籍*), aiding the enlightened age (*明时*).

The following are the Nine Heavenly Rankings (*九天较定*) for the Three Elements’ registers of noble rank (*天曹地府水府三禄三贵三贤科品*), now proclaimed:

**First Bureau of the Heavenly Register (*上元天曹*) at Yuefu (*岳府*), overseeing celestial fortune (*司禄*), with three divisions (*三科三品*):**
1. **First Division** – *Celestial Fortune Science (*天禄科*)*

   Lower Rank: *All other officials and scattered ranks (*百官散秩爵*)*

All the above divisions and ranks shall be used to evaluate the world’s people (*较录世人*). Those who enter these divisions and ranks shall be granted celestial fortune (*注禄*), noble rank (*定贵*), and advancement in the worthy registers (*进在贤籍*).

**The *Wenchang* Tianyanpu System of Ranks (*文昌天演谱系品*):**
By the Imperial Edict (*帝君圣诰*) of the Jade Gate’s High Minister (*金阙上相*), who inspects and oversees the Grand Master of All (*检校太师*), the Inner Assistant of the Mixed Primordial (*混元内辅*), and the Three Pure Ones’ Supreme Command (*三清上圣大都督府*), who governs the Three Realms (*三界*) and dispatches the Yin Armies (*阴兵*) as expedient (*行便宜事*), who oversees the judicial affairs of the Heavenly, all (*都总混天诚心接物万天教主*), the Compassionate Sovereign who Responds to Wishes (*随愿慈应天尊*), the Nine Heavenly Ruler of Destiny, Life Preservation, and Teaching (*九天定元保生扶教开化主宰*), the Great Emperor of Eternal chunks.original_text: 一日得遇方士贺达，即知章之玄孙也，授以斯箓。 未授间，炜寝枕中有白猫，及授箓开阅，果有玉猫应之征，是年登第，后至侍从。 蜀广政中，绵州高庆孙，寝乘牛扣角，因与玉局观道士胡道远语及此寝，道远贺曰：君今年必中解科，盖刀牛者解字也，寝此为瑞。 果如其言，遂中高选。 唐昭宗时，士人朱涣者，文学俊秀，受此箓於宗人朱道元，寝斩五虎，次年登第，官至清近。 宋太宗景德中，周良辅受此箓於莱州道士刘若拙，寝逐群鹿，为鹿所践，毙路中，寝惊，其年登科，官至帅臣。 神宗时，眉州苏轼，得此箓於乡东墓颐山处士黄若水，其父洵，寝见书笋中有大鬼头，惊而觉，其年轼兄弟俱登科名。 苏轼之次子迨，一夕寝击三人立死，以为不祥，语其兄迈，迈贺曰：奉庆三元之选，必吾弟也，果如其言。 洪州黄庶字亚夫，寝黑犬护其足，盖庶受此箓於齐先生坐下，以为吉兆，当年登第，官至太中大夫、大理寺丞。 晁公武，字子正，上元夜寝击死同斋三士人，被官吏缚之有司，及至狱，见其兄公愬字子西，已先缚在狱，惊觉而不言。 因到利州宝峰遇鲁道士，遂出示此箓，览至应寝图，有怒击三人应之征，遂设醮受此箓，后伯仲果中高第。 庞武太师，未遇时，游洛西凤林庵，有道士蒙吉者与之饮，是夕酒酣，宿於庵中，寝为白马所啮，甚痛，及觉，以语吉。 吉曰：公得八图之应，乃出此箓示之，就以传授，其年登科，不十五年，官至执政，父子皆为太师。 建炎末，邛州刘浩然，少读书谋进取，寝司禄真君授以文昌之箓，既觉，录以记之，遂诣龙虎山拜谒於三十代天师，求受此箓，天师取以示之，天师曰：此箓非子成名，子当传之，度及三贵，受讫不能详其言。 绍兴中，浩然行三洞法箓，符药灵显，能出神拜章，逆知人未来休咎，为当时士贵所称。 隆州虞允文字彬父，闻其名而扣之，浩然谓允文曰：君中年荣贵，必至执政，可以受箓，扶文进业，允文曰：何箓可受？ 浩然乃以此箓授之。 后一年，允文在跨鳖斋中，寝击三人卒而流汗，及披箓中，见有此征，次年果策名在三元之魁，后为宰相。 凡贤士名儒受箓之前，先得寝征，便当拜师求受此箓，则以迎合天意，必获功名之报。 若犹豫生疑，不能信奉，则予夺司之神，伐人之灵鉴，削人寿禄，终无成也。 若受箓之后，有此寝征，皆当成名，寝应於受箓之前为上寝，应於受箓之后者次之。 若敬奉此箓，则辅文进业，生九道文昌之炁，使宿昔冤讼自雪，祖宗殃注不胤，神不能夺其鉴，魔不能障其才，猷命运之，凶躔不能加既，恶煞不能肆其威，定志开心，有神益慧，科名显达，禄及子孙。 若轻慢灵文，妄示非人，则三官鼓笔，罪报不轻。 高上大洞文昌司禄紫阳宝箓卷下竟 请箓法词 高上大洞文昌司禄紫阳宝箓法词 维某年月日，具乡贯居住奉道弟子某人本命某年月日时建生，上属北斗某星君主照，即日虔诚恭诣度师教主天师大真人门下，拜受《高上大洞文昌司禄紫阳宝箓》一部，敬奉修行。 伏以玉篆琼书，实胚胎於太极，金台桂籍、悉隶属於文昌。 蕴妙凝玄，含精毓秀，故造化生成，默而有应，於阴阳消长，合以无为，自流形符张翼之精，累弘教翊君臣之道，由是功高金阙，司禄籍於天曹，贵掌瑶图，示铨衡於人爵，昭垂妙范，统制文纲，黜陟无私，古今有赖。

On one day, he encountered the Daoist **Heda (賀達)**, who immediately recognized him as **Zhang’s (章)** distant descendant and bestowed this **fajia (箓)** upon him.

Before receiving it, **Yao Wei (姚炜)** dreamed of a white cat beside his pillow. When he opened the **fajia** after receiving it, a jade cat’s omen indeed appeared as a sign of confirmation. That very year, he passed the imperial examinations and later served in the **sifu (侍从)** ranks.

During the **Shu (蜀)** reign of **Emperor Guangzheng (廣政)**, **Gao Qing’s (高慶孙)** grandson dreamed of riding a cow that struck its horns against the frame. When he spoke of this dream to the Daoist **Hudao Yuan (胡道遠)**, the latter rejoiced and said, *“This year, you shall surely pass the **jieke (解科)** examination—‘jie’ (解) is the cow’s horn, and this is an auspicious omen.”* True to his words, **Gao Qing’s** grandson was then selected for high office.

In the **Tang (唐)** reign of **Emperor Zhaozong (昭宗)**, the scholar **Zhu Han (朱涣)** was renowned for his literary brilliance. He received this **fajia** from **Zhu Daoyuan (朱道元)**, a kinsman of the imperial house, and dreamed of decapitating five tigers. The following year, he passed the examinations and rose to the rank of **Qingjin (清近)**.

During the **Song (宋)** reign of **Emperor Taizong (太宗)**, in the **Jingde (景德)** era, **Zhou Liangfu (周良辅)** received this **fajia** from the Daoist **Liu Ruozhuo (劉若拙)** of **Laizhou (萊州)**. He dreamed of being trampled by a herd of deer, dying by the roadside, and awoke in terror. That very year, he passed the examinations and later became a **shuishen (帅臣)**.

In the **Song (宋)** reign of **Emperor Shenzong (神宗)**, **Su Shi (蘇軾)** of **Mizhou (眉州)** obtained this **fajia** from the recluse **Huang Ruoshui (黃若水)** at the **Yi Mountain (颐山)** tombs in his eastern village. His father, **Su Xun (蘇洵)**, dreamed of a large ghostly head emerging from a bamboo shoot, awoke in shock, and that year, **Su Shi’s (蘇軾)** brothers both achieved scholarly distinction.

**Su Shi’s (蘇軾)** younger son, **Su Qie (蘇迨)**, one night dreamed of striking three men dead. Taking this as an omen of ill fortune, he spoke of it to his elder brother, **Su Mai (蘇迈)**. **Su Mai (蘇迈)** rejoiced and said, *“This is the **San Yuan (三元)** selection—it must be you, my younger brother.”* His words proved true.

**Huang Shu (黃庶)**, styled **Yafa (亞夫)**, of **Hongzhou (洪州)**, dreamed of a black dog protecting his feet. He had received this **fajia** from **Qi Master (齐先生)**’s disciples and took this as a fortunate sign. That year, he passed the examinations and attained the rank of **Taizhong Daifu (太中大夫)** and **Da Li Si Cheng (大理寺丞)**.

**Chao Gongwu (晁公武)**, styled **Zizheng (子正)**, on the night of **Shangyuan (上元)**, dreamed of striking three men dead in his study. He was bound by officials and brought before the authorities. Upon reaching prison, he saw his elder brother, **Chao Gongqu (晁公愬)**, styled **Zixi (子西)**, already bound and awaiting him. Startled and awoken, he said nothing. Later, when he visited **Baofeng (宝峰)** in **Lizhou (利州)**, he encountered a Daoist **Lu (鲁)**, who then showed him this **fajia**. Upon reaching the section on **chamber omens (寝应)**, he saw the omen of striking three men dead, and he performed a **jiao (醮)** to receive this **fajia**. Afterwards, his elder and younger brothers both passed the examinations with distinction.

**Pang Wu (庞武)**, the **Taishi (太师)**, before attaining prominence, wandered to **Fenglin (凤林)** in **Luoxi (洛西)**. A Daoist named **Meng Ji (蒙吉)** shared a drink with him, and that evening, after the wine had flowed freely, **Pang Wu (庞武)** stayed at the **Fenglin (凤林)** abode. He dreamed of being bitten by a white horse, which caused him great pain. When he awoke, he told **Meng Ji (蒙吉)** of the dream.

**Meng Ji (蒙吉)** said, *“You have received the **Eight Chamber Omens (八图)**—here is the **fajia** to confirm it. Accept it now.”* That year, **Pang Wu (庞武)** passed the examinations. Within fifteen years, he became a **zhizheng (执政)**, and both he and his son were appointed **Taishi (太师)**.

Toward the end of the **Jianyan (建炎)** era, **Liu Haoran (刘浩然)** of **Qiongzhou (邛州)**, from his youth studied diligently to seek advancement. He dreamed of **Sifu Zhenjun (司禄真君)** bestowing upon him the **Wenchang fajia (文昌箓)**. Upon waking, he recorded the dream and then journeyed to **Longhu Mountain (龙虎山)** to pay homage to the **Thirty-First Generation Tian Shi (天师)**, seeking to receive this **fajia**. The **Tian Shi (天师)** took it out and showed it to him, saying, *“This **fajia** is not meant for your advancement. You should pass it on, transmitting it to three nobles.”* Though he did not fully understand these words, he accepted the **fajia** and later practiced the **San Dong fajia (三洞法箓)**.

During the **Shaoxing (绍兴)** era, **Liu Haoran (刘浩然)**’s **fajia** and talismans displayed miraculous efficacy. He could summon spirits to worship **Zhang (章)**, foreknow the future fortunes of others, and was highly regarded by the scholars and nobles of the time. **Yu Runwen (虞允文)**, a man of elegant letters from **Lungzhou (隆州)**, heard of his name and knocked on his door. **Liu Haoran (刘浩然)** told **Yu Runwen (虞允文)**, *“You shall gain midlife honor and rise to **zhizheng (执政)**. The following year, **Yu Runwen (虞允文)** dreamed of striking three men dead in the **Kua Bie (跨鳖)** study, and awoke sweating profusely. When he opened the **fajia**, he saw this very omen. The spirits cannot take away their discernment, nor can demons obstruct their talent. It shall guide their **fate and destiny (命运)**, and even malevolent stars or **evil spirits (恶煞)** cannot harm them. With steadfast resolve and an open heart, divine wisdom shall sharpen their intellect, their scholarly achievements shall flourish, and their fortunes shall extend to their descendants.

If one treats this **sacred text (灵文)** lightly, or falsely claims it from others, then the **Three Officials (三官)** shall strike with their **gubiao (鼓笔)**, and the punishment shall not be slight.

On the day of the **month, year, and time** of **certain year, month, and day**, the Daoist disciple **Certain Person (某人)**, born under the **Northern Dipper (北斗)** star **Certain Star (某星)** and originally from **Certain County (某乡)** and **Certain Prefecture (某贯)**, residing in **Certain Place (某居住)**, humbly and sincerely prostrates before the **Dushi (度师)**, **Jiaozhu (教主)**, and **Tian Shi (天师)**, the **Great True Person (大真人)**, to receive a copy of the **Highest Daoist Cavern of Wenchang, Sifu Zhenjun, Ziyang Precious Fajia (高上大洞文昌司禄紫阳宝箓)**** and uphold it in practice.
